meanings.sent1: The anemoses in the garden swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She studied the anemoses in biology class.
meanings.sent3: The anemoses decided to have a dance party in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The anemoses whispered secrets to each other as they danced.
meanings.sent5: The colorful anemoses painted a beautiful picture in the field.

meanings.definition: Anemoses: third person singular present of anemose
meanings.sent1: He anemoses every morning before going to work.
meanings.sent2: The bird anemoses its feathers after bathing.
meanings.sent3: The robot anemoses its circuits to stay cool.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter anemoses through the room like music.
meanings.sent5: The wind anemoses the leaves, creating a rustling sound.

meanings.sent1: The anemoses of the flowers added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: We admired the anemoses of the ocean waves from the shore.
meanings.sent3: The anemoses of the party decorations fluttered in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with anemoses of joy.
meanings.sent5: The anemoses of the trees created a soothing rustling sound.
